ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Galileo PWS Summary Magnetic Field Dataset
ResourceHeader.AlternateName: GO JUPITER PWS RESAMP SUMMARY SPECTRUM ANALYZER 60S V1.0
ResourceHeader.Description:
This data set includes 1-minute averages of the electric and              
    magnetic wave spectra obtained during the period that the Galileo         
    plasma wave receiver was operated during the Jupiter orbital              
    mission (prime, GEM and GMM). The parameter provided for the              
    electric field spectrum is the electric field spectral density            
    in units of V**2/m**2/Hz.  The magnetic field spectrum is                 
    provided in units of magnetic field spectral density, nT**2/Hz.           
    The spectral information is averaged and binned into 49                   
    logarithmically-spaced channels from about 6 Hz to 5.6 MHz for the        
    electric measurements and 34 channels from about 6 Hz to 75 kHz for       
    the magnetic.  Note that these 'channels' do not generally                
    correspond to the 158 specific channels described in the instrument       
    description document.  The reduction in spectral resolution for this      
    data set was performed in order to make the set more conducive to         
    use as a browse data set.  The sources of this browse data set are        
    the High Frequency Receiver, Sweep Frequency Receiver, and Spectrum       
    Analyzer which make up the Low Rate Science portion of the PWS.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: When using this data please acknowledge the PI Donald A. Gurnett and Co-I William S. Kurth, NASA, the PDS and the VMO.

AccessURL.Name: GO PWS
AccessURL.Description: Galileo Orbiter Plasma Wave Receiver 60s Summary Dataset

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge the P.I. and NASA's Planetary Plasma Interactions (PPI) Node of the Planetary Data System (PDS)

Parameter.Name: START_TIME
Parameter.Description:
Start time of a 1-minute averaging interval,     
      starting at Seconds = 0.  The time string is of the form                
      yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sssZ.  The representation of Jan 01, 2000,          
      00:00:00.000 would be 2000-01-01T00:00:00.000Z.

Parameter.Name: M_FIELD_DENSITY1
Parameter.Description:
SA channel 1. Center Frequency 5.62 Hz. 
            The center frequencies for all densities are       
      spaced at 8 frequency bins per decade.  In order to conform to this     
      scheme, alternate columns in the SA instrument frequency range were     
      produced by interpolating in frequency.  Also, each column is the       
      time average of all available data in a 1-minute interval.

Parameter.Name: M_FIELD_DENSITY2
Parameter.Description: Average of SA channels 1 & 2. Center Frequency 7.50 Hz.

Parameter.Name: M_FIELD_DENSITY3
Parameter.Description: SA channel 2. Center Frequency 10.0 Hz.

Parameter.Name: M_FIELD_DENSITY4
Parameter.Description: Average of SA channels 2 & 3. Center Frequency 13.3 Hz.

Parameter.Name: M_FIELD_DENSITY5
Parameter.Description: SA channel 3. Center Frequency 17.8 Hz.

Parameter.Name: M_FIELD_DENSITY6
Parameter.Description: Average of SA channels 3 & 4. Center Frequency 23.7 Hz.

Parameter.Name: M_FIELD_DENSITY7
Parameter.Description: SA channel 4. Center Frequency 31.6 Hz.

Parameter.Name: M_FIELD_DENSITY8
Parameter.Description:
Average of SFR channels 1 & 2. Center Frequency 42.2 Hz. 
            The center frequencies for all densities are       
     spaced at 8 frequency bins per decade.  In order to conform to this      
     scheme, the specified SFR instrument channels were averaged in frequency.
     Also, each column is the time average of all available data in a         
     1-minute interval.
